Stippling

We begin a set of sketches based around a technique of stippling. This technique is noise-based and computationally very fast --- but I now see it has the downside of not giving beautifully uniform stippling. Thus this is something to return to should I ever decide to implement a better stippling algorithm. (The naive one where one looks at lots and lots of points and checks that none are too near might even be just fine for not-too-many-points).

Sketches

  • In this sketch, we have some basic stippling.
  • Compare that to this sketch, which has randomness instead of uniformity.
  • This sketch is actually a test of a stipple rectangle class I wrote.
  • This sketch uses that class to produce a set of stripes. Note that for higher density, it's not-quite uniform.

Ideas

Art is supposed to hold some additional markings, like a set of cubic curves or something. The cubic interpolator class was written for this.
